body:
You know what... I have no idea what version we're using. There's a sel_ldr
binary we download from cloud storage that was built by someone a while
ago. :-|

On 3 September 2015 at 06:10, Minux Ma <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Andrew, what's version of nacl runtime that is used on the
> playground service?
>
> Perhaps it's too old to support the get_random_bytes syscall that
> Go uses to emulate /dev/urandom.
>
> We require at least pepper_39 according to misc/nacl/README.
>
> I just verified that the program works correctly with Go 1.5 and
> correct version of sel_ldr.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/5096#issuecomment-137229513>.
>
